title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: Odiffr provides R bindings Odiff, blazing-fast pixel--pixel image comparison tool. ’s designed : Visual regression testing Shiny apps reports Quality assurance validated pharmaceutical environments Automated image analysis workflows

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: Odiffr requires Odiff binary installed system: install Odiff system-wide, use odiffr_update() installing package download binary user cache.
code: # npm (cross-platform, recommended) npm install -g odiff-bin  # Or download binaries from GitHub releases # https://github.com/dmtrKovalenko/odiff/releases

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
code: # From CRAN (when available) install.packages("odiffr")  # Development version pak::pak("BenWolst/odiffr")

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
code: library(odiffr)

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
code: # Verify Odiff is available odiff_available()  # View configuration details odiff_info()

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: main function compare_images(), returns tibble (data.frame):
code: result <- compare_images("baseline.png", "current.png") result #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   match reason     diff_count diff_percentage diff_output img1         img2 #>   <lgl> <chr>           <int>           <dbl> <chr>       <chr>        <chr> #> 1 FALSE pixel-diff       1234            2.45 NA          baseline.png current.png

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
code: # Specify output path result <- compare_images("baseline.png", "current.png",                          diff_output = "diff.png")  # Or use TRUE for auto-generated temp file result <- compare_images("baseline.png", "current.png",                          diff_output = TRUE) result$diff_output #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpXXXXXX/file12345.png"

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: threshold parameter (0-1) controls color sensitivity. Lower values precise:
code: # Very strict comparison result <- compare_images("img1.png", "img2.png", threshold = 0.01)  # More lenient (ignore minor color variations) result <- compare_images("img1.png", "img2.png", threshold = 0.2)

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: Ignore antialiased pixels often differ renders:
code: result <- compare_images("img1.png", "img2.png", antialiasing = TRUE)

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: Exclude specific areas comparison (useful timestamps, dynamic content):
code: result <- compare_images("img1.png", "img2.png",   ignore_regions = list(     ignore_region(x1 = 0, y1 = 0, x2 = 200, y2 = 50),    # Header     ignore_region(x1 = 0, y1 = 900, x2 = 1920, y2 = 1080) # Footer   ) )

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: Compare multiple image pairs efficiently:
code: pairs <- data.frame(   img1 = c("baseline/page1.png", "baseline/page2.png", "baseline/page3.png"),   img2 = c("current/page1.png", "current/page2.png", "current/page3.png") )  results <- compare_images_batch(pairs, diff_dir = "diffs/")  # View failures results[!results$match, ]

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: Compare images two directories matching filenames: Note: compare_image_dirs() matches files name directories. files current/ matching baseline, message printed showing files skipped.
code: # Compare baseline/ vs current/ directories results <- compare_image_dirs("baseline/", "current/")  # Include subdirectories results <- compare_image_dirs("baseline/", "current/", recursive = TRUE)  # Only compare PNG files results <- compare_image_dirs("baseline/", "current/", pattern = "\\.png$")

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: Extract passing failing pairs batch results:
code: results <- compare_image_dirs("baseline/", "current/")  # Get only failures failures <- failed_pairs(results) nrow(failures) #> [1] 8  # Get only passes passes <- passed_pairs(results) nrow(passes) #> [1] 42

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: Get aggregate statistics batch results:
code: results <- compare_image_dirs("baseline/", "current/") summary(results) #> odiffr batch comparison: 50 pairs #> ─────────────────────────────────── #> Passed: 42 (84.0%) #> Failed: 8 (16.0%) #>   - pixel-diff: 6 #>   - layout-diff: 2 #> #> Diff statistics (failed pairs): #>   Min:    0.15% #>   Median: 2.34% #>   Mean:   3.21% #>   Max:    12.45% #> #> Worst offenders: #>   1. page_a.png (12.45%, 1245 pixels) #>   2. page_b.png (8.32%, 832 pixels)

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: odiffr_batch object returned compare_images_batch() compare_image_dirs() contains columns:

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: Speed batch comparisons using multiple CPU cores (Unix ): Note: Windows, parallel = TRUE falls back sequential processing.
code: # Compare in parallel on macOS/Linux results <- compare_images_batch(pairs, parallel = TRUE)  # Also works with directory comparison results <- compare_image_dirs("baseline/", "current/", parallel = TRUE)

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: Generate standalone HTML reports QA review: Reports include: - Pass/fail statistics visual cards - Failure reason breakdown - Diff statistics (min, median, mean, max) - Worst offenders table thumbnails relative_paths option useful want move share report along diff images folder. relative paths, report find images regardless files moved.
code: # Run batch comparison with diff images results <- compare_image_dirs(   "baseline/",   "current/",   diff_dir = "diffs/" )  # Generate HTML report (links to diff images) batch_report(results, output_file = "qa-report.html")  # Self-contained report with embedded images (for sharing) batch_report(results, output_file = "qa-report.html", embed = TRUE)  # Portable report with relative paths (move report + diffs together) batch_report(results, output_file = "output/report.html", relative_paths = TRUE)  # Customize the report batch_report(   results,   output_file = "report.html",   title = "Dashboard Visual Regression",   n_worst = 20,        # Show top 20 failures   show_all = TRUE      # Include all comparisons, not just failures )

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: common workflow comparing directories generating report, use compare_dirs_report():
code: # Compare and generate report in one step compare_dirs_report("baseline/", "current/") # -> Creates diffs/ directory with diff images and report.html  # Self-contained report with embedded images (recommended for sharing) compare_dirs_report("baseline/", "current/", embed = TRUE)  # See all comparisons, not just failures compare_dirs_report("baseline/", "current/", show_all = TRUE)  # Portable report with relative image paths compare_dirs_report("baseline/", "current/", relative_paths = TRUE)  # Combine options: parallel processing with embedded report compare_dirs_report("baseline/", "current/", parallel = TRUE, embed = TRUE)

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: compare_dirs_report() one-liner ideal CI pipelines: GitHub Actions, upload diffs/ artifact failure:
code: # In your CI script results <- compare_dirs_report("baseline/", "current/")  # Fail the build if any images differ if (any(!results$match)) {   stop("Visual regression detected! See diffs/ for details.") } - name: Upload diffs   if: failure()   uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4   with:     name: visual-diffs     path: diffs/

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: Odiffr integrates magick package preprocessing:
code: library(magick)  # Read and preprocess images img1 <- image_read("baseline.png") |>   image_resize("800x600") |>   image_convert(colorspace = "sRGB")  img2 <- image_read("current.png") |>   image_resize("800x600") |>   image_convert(colorspace = "sRGB")  # Compare directly result <- compare_images(img1, img2)

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: full control, use odiff_run():
code: result <- odiff_run(   img1 = "baseline.png",   img2 = "current.png",   diff_output = "diff.png",   threshold = 0.1,   antialiasing = TRUE,   fail_on_layout = TRUE,   diff_mask = FALSE,   diff_overlay = 0.5,   diff_color = "#FF00FF",   diff_lines = TRUE,   reduce_ram = FALSE,   ignore_regions = list(ignore_region(10, 10, 100, 50)),   timeout = 60 )  # Detailed result result$match result$reason result$diff_count result$diff_percentage result$diff_lines result$exit_code result$duration

code: # Latest version odiffr_update()  # Specific version odiffr_update(version = "v4.1.2")

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: Use specific binary (useful validated environments):
code: options(odiffr.path = "/validated/bin/odiff-4.1.2")

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
code: # View cache location odiffr_cache_path() # Clear cached binaries odiffr_clear_cache()

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: Odiffr provides dedicated testthat expectations visual regression testing:
code: library(testthat) library(odiffr)  test_that("dashboard renders correctly", {   skip_if_no_odiff()    # Generate current screenshot (using your preferred method)   webshot2::webshot("http://localhost:3838/dashboard", "current.png")    # Compare to baseline using expect_images_match()   expect_images_match(     "current.png",     "baselines/dashboard.png",     threshold = 0.1,     antialiasing = TRUE   ) })  test_that("button changes on hover", {   skip_if_no_odiff()    # Assert that images are different   expect_images_differ(     "button_normal.png",     "button_hover.png"   ) })

title: Getting Started with Odiffr
text: expect_images_match() fails, diff image automatically saved tests/testthat/_odiffr/ debugging. Control behavior options:
code: # Disable diff image saving options(odiffr.save_diff = FALSE)  # Use a custom directory options(odiffr.diff_dir = "my_diffs/")

code: odiff_run(   img1,   img2,   diff_output = NULL,   threshold = 0.1,   antialiasing = FALSE,   fail_on_layout = FALSE,   diff_mask = FALSE,   diff_overlay = NULL,   diff_color = NULL,   diff_lines = FALSE,   reduce_ram = FALSE,   ignore_regions = NULL,   timeout = 60 )

title: Run odiff Command (Low-Level) — odiff_run
text: img1 Character; path first (baseline) image file. img2 Character; path second (comparison) image file. diff_output Character NULL; optional path diff output image. Must .png extension. NULL, diff image created. threshold Numeric; color difference threshold 0.0 1.0. Lower values precise. Default 0.1. antialiasing Logical; TRUE, ignore antialiased pixels. Default FALSE. fail_on_layout Logical; TRUE, fail immediately images different dimensions. Default FALSE. diff_mask Logical; TRUE, output changed pixels diff image. Default FALSE. diff_overlay Logical numeric; TRUE number 0 1, add white shaded overlay diff image easier reading. Default NULL (overlay). diff_color Character; hex color highlighting differences (e.g., "#FF0000"). Default NULL (uses odiff default, red). diff_lines Logical; TRUE, include line numbers containing different pixels output. Default FALSE. reduce_ram Logical; TRUE, use less memory run slower. Useful large images. Default FALSE. ignore_regions list regions ignore comparison. region list x1, y1, x2, y2 components, use ignore_region() create . Can also data.frame columns. timeout Numeric; timeout seconds odiff process. Default 60.

title: Run odiff Command (Low-Level) — odiff_run
text: list following components: match Logical; TRUE images match, FALSE otherwise. reason Character; one "match", "pixel-diff", "layout-diff", "error". diff_count Integer; number different pixels, NA. diff_percentage Numeric; percentage different pixels, NA. diff_lines Integer vector line numbers differences, NULL. exit_code Integer; odiff exit code (0 = match, 21 = layout diff, 22 = pixel diff). stdout Character; raw stdout output. stderr Character; raw stderr output. img1 Character; path first image. img2 Character; path second image. diff_output Character NULL; path diff image created. duration Numeric; time elapsed seconds.

title: Run odiff Command (Low-Level) — odiff_run
